verbose_text: In a study of PG inactivation by PEF, Chen Yi et al. [XREF_BIBR] found that when the amplitude of pulse voltage was 20 kV/cm and the number of pulses increased from 30 gradients to 270 (increase in processing time), the PG activity decreased from 78.9% to 31.2%, and the passivation effect of PG was significantly enhanced, reflecting that the cell infection activity was significantly affected (P < 0.01).
